edu.caltech.sbw
Class Proc

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.caltech.sbw.Proc
public final class Proc
extends Object

Wrapper around the Java Process object to exec a command and provide the process with handlers for stdout and stderr. The handlers simply log (as "notice" events) any output generated by the subprocess.

A Proc object implements the same methods as the standard java.lang.Process class, and can be used in the same ways that a Process object would be used.

Version:
$Revision: 1.2 $
Author:
Michael Hucka, $Author: mhucka $

Constructor Detail

Proc

public Proc(String title,
            String cmd,
            int startupWait)
     throws IOException,
            SecurityException
Creates a process object, execs the given command, gives it a title, and supplies the process with handlers for stdout and stderr. Waits for a certain amount of time given in tenths of seconds by the startupWait parameter before returning; this gives a chance for long-startup commands (like exec'ing java) to start.
Parameters:
displayName - a string to identify the process in messages, etc.
cmd - the command line to execute
startupWait - the time to wait for start up, in tenths of seconds
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs
SecurityException - if a security manager exists and its checkExec method doesn't allow creation of a subprocess
Method Detail

getOutputStream

public final OutputStream getOutputStream()
Gets the output stream of the subprocess. Output to the stream is piped into the standard input stream of the process represented by this Process object.

Implementation note: It is a good idea for the output stream to be buffered.

Returns:
the output stream connected to the normal input of the subprocess.

getInputStream

public final InputStream getInputStream()
Gets the input stream of the subprocess. The stream obtains data piped from the standard output stream of the process represented by this Process object.

Implementation note: It is a good idea for the input stream to be buffered.

Returns:
the input stream connected to the normal output of the subprocess.

getErrorStream

public final InputStream getErrorStream()
Gets the error stream of the subprocess. The stream obtains data piped from the error output stream of the process represented by this Process object.

Implementation note: It is a good idea for the input stream to be buffered.

Returns:
the input stream connected to the error stream of the subprocess.

waitFor

public final int waitFor()
                  throws InterruptedException
Causes the current thread to wait, if necessary, until the process represented by this Process object has terminated. This method returns immediately if the subprocess has already terminated. If the subprocess has not yet terminated, the calling thread will be blocked until the subprocess exits.
Returns:
the exit value of the process. By convention, 0 indicates normal termination.
Throws:
InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted by another thread while it is waiting, then the wait is ended and an InterruptedException is thrown.

exitValue

public final int exitValue()
Returns the exit value for the subprocess.
Returns:
the exit value of the subprocess represented by this Process object. by convention, the value 0 indicates normal termination.
Throws:
IllegalThreadStateException - if the subprocess represented by this Process object has not yet terminated.

destroy

public final void destroy()
Kills the subprocess. The subprocess represented by the underlying Process object is forcibly terminated.

appearsStarted

public final boolean appearsStarted()

appearsRunning

public final boolean appearsRunning()
